metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11721 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in ioquake3 before 2017-08-02 allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecifiedother impact via a crafted packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11721` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ioquake3 - 1.36+u20170803+dfsg1-1
ioquake3-server - 1.36+u20170803+dfsg1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

rtcw - 1.51+dfsg1-3
rtcw-common - 1.51+dfsg1-3
rtcw-server - 1.51+dfsg1-3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ioquake3 package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.36+u20170803+dfsg1-1').
iortcw package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.51+dfsg1-3').
